IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Building leaders to protect the West's land, air, and water.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Building leaders to protect the West's land, air, and water.
IRS990.Desc: Accountability:Builds champions for conservation by bringing new voices to the conservation debate, identifying timely issues, and educating the public about actions taken by public officials that impact the Western United States' natural resources.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Special Opportunities:Funds projects that complement the Foundation's mission but fall outside targeted geographies.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grantees are required to submit written narratives and financial reports to describe how funds were used.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is reviewed and approved by the Finance Committee and then made available to the Board of Directors prior to submission to the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization requires the officers, directors and trustees to disclose any conflicts of interest on an annual basis. Potential conflicts, whether initially disclosed or subsequently discovered, are reviewed by the Board of Directors to determine if the conflict actually exists. Officers, directors and trustees recuse themselves from voting on matters for which there may be a potential conflict of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO, top management and staff complete an annual review process. Documentation from this review is used by the CEO and the Board of Directors, in the case of the CEO, to determine salary amounts or salary increases. Salary for the CEO is set based on the Board's knowledge of salary levels in comparable organizations/positions and executive salaries paid by their peers in the Colorado non-profit community, courtesy of Charity Navigator.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No documents are available to the public.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes a copy of its Forms 1023 and 990 available to the public upon request.

The Foundation's Board of Directors assumes the responsibility for oversight of the audit of its financial statements and the selection of an independent accountant. This process has not changed from the prior years.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Increase political power of the western conservation movement.
